item.title: How Two Divergent Mental Models of Orienteering and Topographic Thinking Can Help Us Understand The World
item.description: Introduction Recently, I picked up an old college textbook I’d saved, thinking someday I’d peruse it’s pages and maybe get interested in Biology again. Well the other day I finally did. While reading the introduction, two mental models stood out to me. In this piece, I’m going to relate these models as my professor taught them, and then extend it to Plato and courage, however, as I hope you’ll see, these models have implications beyond Biology and Plato.
